channel.title: Pings?
channel.description: ok well some people were talking about "pinging" someones computer. and i was wondring what that means and how to do it?

item.title: Pings?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Mr.Chris:

Well, pinging is pretty useless this day and age. All it is sending 30 bytes to a computer over and over again trying to render the internet useless. It really isn’t worth it because 30 bytes is nothing.

You can use this “ping -l 65000 -t microsoft.com” witch sends 65000 bytes, but I’m not exactly sure if I got the parms write.

Read full topic

item.title: Pings?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

We’ve already told you, pinging someone is not going to crash their internet, seriosuly whats 30bytes going to do to anyone?

Well, unless they’re playing CS:S on a laggy server with a 56K modem on 256mB Ram. That might just put them over the top…

Read full topic

You can use Ping -f to flood the host with pings, though it is pointless :P.

[/quote]
An example of a domain name: www.impsoft.net[/quote]
lets use that as the official ‘‘beginner ping’’

item.title: Pings?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Pinging somebodies computer is like my computer saying “Hi are you there?” to your computer. XD

It tells you how long it took to respond. If you play any online games you will notice you have a “Ping” that shows you how much lag you are getting.

Read full topic

item.title: Pings?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Well, pinging is pretty useless this day and age. All it is sending 30 bytes to a computer over and over again trying to render the internet useless. It really isn’t worth it because 30 bytes is nothing.

If you want to take down someones internet, get a DOSer. Denial Of Service. It sends packets to your computers internet connection and takes up all the bandwidth making the internet nearly impossible to use. If you want to take down a small company, for example, you would want to DDOS which is “Distributed Denial Of Service”. That is using many computers sending many packets to bring down the companies internet which can result ina big loss for that company.

I would just like to point out it is illegal.

Read full topic
